instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift/option/control not working
threads.message:
Board after liquid damage near <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

Left shift/option/control wont works.
Tested with 100% working keyboard/trackpad and same story.

Checked area <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> and was clean but just in case replaced them and same issue.
<CHIP>U4850</CHIP>/10 = 3.4V
<CHIP>U4830</CHIP>/9 = 3.3V

Any idea?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift/option/control not working
threads.message:
Check continuity on all traces from the keyboard connector to the keyboard IC. 

Tried a known good keyboard?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift/option/control not working
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left shift/option/control not working
threads.message:
SOLVED
Keyboard connector pin 4 had 0.0V (pin was looking OK, so path was damaged)
Jumper and works fine now. Many thanks :)
